  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public abstract class AbstractInterruptibleModule
extends AbstractModule
implements InterruptibleModule
    Abstract implementation of the InterruptibleModule interface.

    The interruptible version of the run-method sets the given interrupter in the interrupter registry and clears it after the module is finished.

    Author:
    Jonas Prellberg

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run(ModuleInput input,
                ModuleOutput output,
                Interrupter interrupter)
         throws ModuleException,
                UncheckedInterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: InterruptibleModule
        Perform some computation in an interruptible manner on the values stored in the ModuleInput object and store the results in the ModuleOutput object. To retrieve values from ModuleInput object the ModuleInput.getParameter(String, Class) method can be used. To store values in the ModuleOutput object the ModuleOutput.setReturnValue(String, Class, Object) method can be used. The possible values in both the ModuleInput and ModuleOutput object are determined entirely by the specifications in the Module.require(ModuleInputSpec) and Module.provide(ModuleOutputSpec) method respectively.
        Specified by:
        run in interface InterruptibleModule
        Parameters:
        input - storage of the inputs
        output - storage of the outputs
        interrupter - callback that will be periodically checked and decides if the module should prematurely abort with an InterruptedException
        Throws:
        ModuleException - On various kinds of errors that prevent the module from working.
        UncheckedInterruptedException - thrown when the module is interrupted before completion
